channel.name: For Loops for Arrays in MINA?

messages.content: I am trying to multiply two vector arrays inside MINA using for loop but cannot find the code to multiply for loop inside MINA, can someone help me out here?
@technical community ambassador @Onboarding Team  Just tagging peeps as here as I need urgent help at #EthIndia.

Check out this Matrix Mul function here: https://github.com/o1-labs/snarkyjs/blob/0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898/src/examples/matrix_mul.ts#L21

You define a standard for loop with the vector you want to iterate over and inside the body, you must use `.mul` to multiply the elements you want. Just remember that the size of the for loop must be static and can't be dynamic in your circuits!

embeds.title: snarkyjs/matrix_mul.ts at 0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898 ...
embeds.description: Typescript/Javascript framework for zk-SNARKs and zkApps - snarkyjs/matrix_mul.ts at 0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898 · o1-labs/snarkyjs

messages.content: @o1martin so it would defined as `@state(Field) x[] = State<Field[]>();`  ? Is there an example of input as an array?
You can’t set a state variable as a dynamic javascript array.  You need to use @arrayProp
Is there an example for the same?

Yep! The only okayish example I could find in the SnarkyJS repo is this one here:

https://github.com/o1-labs/snarkyjs/blob/0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898/src/lib/string.ts#L39

`Character` is defined as a CircuitValue above `CircuitString`

embeds.title: snarkyjs/string.ts at 0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898 · o1...
embeds.description: Typescript/Javascript framework for zk-SNARKs and zkApps - snarkyjs/string.ts at 0969069cc72b10694b8dbea93046edc8b50ae898 · o1-labs/snarkyjs

messages.content: `@arrayProp(Field, 10) values: Field[];`
That works too I think!
Gotcha, thanks a lot. Is it okay if I post my complete contract code in some time for you to review?
It's just that I am awake for the hackathon and really want to complete it.
Sure thing!
@o1martin  I am trying to take module vector * keyword vector in matching algorithm.
If the computed value is greater than treshold then it returns as true.
Gotcha! If you want to return a boolean condition, you need to replace your `Circuit.if` expression to return `Bool(true)` and `Bool(false)` instead of `1` and `0`
Is the initState method defined correctly?
Can we have 10 Field Array on Chain?
The max amount of on chain storage a zkapp is allowed is 8 field elements so this is too big as of right now :/
😦 is there any other way?
So given you have a state variable for `keyword`, `history` can be a max size of 7
As of right now, there isn't a way to increase storage unfortunately

You _could_ store `history` as off-chain storage and instead store a commitment but that's rather complex and I wouldn't recommend going down that route if you're just trying to get things to work as of right now

Can we fetch off chain storage from a commitment? I intend to submit this project as part of zkIgnite as well. 

Secondly, Is the initState correctly defined?
Thanks a lot for helping me out 🙂
initState looks right to me!
Gotcha, thanks a lot again!
Oh wait, I think there's a bug
@o1martin ?
I am just little confused about the way arrays are defined here.
It says `CircuitValue` is deprecated here!

How do I access it? 
`this.History.get()` should give me an array, right? but how do I store and fetch the field value?

You can fetch the value by using
```ts
zkapp.history.get().history[n])
```
I want to do this.History.get()[0].mul (asc)
This would be on deploy script I am assuming?
`this.history.get().history[0];` this works
thanks!!
Perfect!

@o1martin 
I am getting this error on running `node build/src/main.js`
``` Cannot find module '/Users/vaibhavgeek/hackathons/ethindia/circuits_mina/build/src/MatchMeBetter' imported from /Users/vaibhavgeek/hackathons/ethindia/circuits_mina/build/src/main.js 
```
It worked by changing the  `./matchbetter` to `./matchbetter.js`
How much time does it usually take?
Resolved this, some issue with typescript.
Successfully deployed the contract folks!!!!

https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/transaction/Ckpa1v85cx3iQX8G7krQdBPdo5eYCsJBqS8x5rrwWV36dqQw1DSy5  

Where is the contract address?
@o1martin ?

It should be `B62qiieACgT2D7v2Bw1Cdvyp867phfDpBZ5WWHhgZJmKdNDMRwccau4`. 

If you expand the `Other Accounts Raw`, the first entry in the body should contain the address you deployed too
That's my account address.
Is it same as contract address? 🤔
Yup! A zkApp is nothing more than an account that has an attached verification key too it 😄
Noted, thanks!
Just used to account and contract address being different.
hi, so this is a different usecase ...but is there a way to somehow use arrayProps to pass arrays to method calls?
i want to pass Field[] to a method call
You can create a struct and pass an array of struct.
realized actually we can do arrays, but only fixed length arrays
Gotcha, can you share code? Maybe I can help.
